00059 /* wmSubWindow stored in wmWindow... but not exposed outside this C file */
00060 /* it seems a bit redundant (area regions can store it too, but we keep it
00061  * because we can store all kind of future opengl fanciness here */
00062 
00063 /* we use indices and array because:
00064  * - index has safety, no pointers from this C file hanging around
00065  * - fast lookups of indices with array, list would give overhead
00066  * - old code used it this way...
00067  * - keep option open to have 2 screens using same window
00068  */
00069 
00070 typedef struct wmSubWindow {
00071     struct wmSubWindow *next, *prev;
00072     
00073     rcti winrct;
00074     int swinid;
00075 } wmSubWindow;
00076 
00077 
00078 /* ******************* open, free, set, get data ******************** */
00079 
00080 /* not subwindow itself */
00081 static void wm_subwindow_free(wmSubWindow *UNUSED(swin))
00082 {
00083     /* future fancy stuff */
00084 }
00085 
00086 void wm_subwindows_free(wmWindow *win)
00087 {
00088     wmSubWindow *swin;
00089     
00090     for (swin = win->subwindows.first; swin; swin = swin->next)
00091         wm_subwindow_free(swin);
00092     
00093     BLI_freelistN(&win->subwindows);
00094 }
00095 
00096 
00097 int wm_subwindow_get(wmWindow *win) 
00098 {
00099     if (win->curswin)
00100         return win->curswin->swinid;
00101     return 0;
00102 }
00103 
00104 static wmSubWindow *swin_from_swinid(wmWindow *win, int swinid)
00105 {
00106     wmSubWindow *swin;
00107     
00108     for (swin = win->subwindows.first; swin; swin = swin->next)
00109         if (swin->swinid == swinid)
00110             break;
00111     return swin;
00112 }
00113 
00114 void wm_subwindow_getsize(wmWindow *win, int swinid, int *x, int *y) 
00115 {
00116     wmSubWindow *swin = swin_from_swinid(win, swinid);
00117 
00118     if (swin) {
00119         *x = swin->winrct.xmax - swin->winrct.xmin + 1;
00120         *y = swin->winrct.ymax - swin->winrct.ymin + 1;
00121     }
00122 }
00123 
00124 void wm_subwindow_getorigin(wmWindow *win, int swinid, int *x, int *y)
00125 {
00126     wmSubWindow *swin = swin_from_swinid(win, swinid);
00127 
00128     if (swin) {
00129         *x = swin->winrct.xmin;
00130         *y = swin->winrct.ymin;
00131     }
00132 }
00133 
00134 void wm_subwindow_getmatrix(wmWindow *win, int swinid, float mat[][4])
00135 {
00136     wmSubWindow *swin = swin_from_swinid(win, swinid);
00137 
00138     if (swin) {
00139         /* used by UI, should find a better way to get the matrix there */
00140         if (swinid == win->screen->mainwin) {
00141             int width, height;
00142 
00143             wm_subwindow_getsize(win, swin->swinid, &width, &height);
00144             orthographic_m4(mat, -0.375f, (float)width - 0.375f, -0.375f, (float)height - 0.375f, -100, 100);
00145         }
00146         else
00147             glGetFloatv(GL_PROJECTION_MATRIX, (float *)mat);
00148     }
00149 }
00150 
00151 /* always sets pixel-precise 2D window/view matrices */
00152 /* coords is in whole pixels. xmin = 15, xmax= 16: means window is 2 pix big */
00153 int wm_subwindow_open(wmWindow *win, rcti *winrct)
00154 {
00155     wmSubWindow *swin;
00156     int width, height;
00157     int freewinid = 1;
00158     
00159     for (swin = win->subwindows.first; swin; swin = swin->next)
00160         if (freewinid <= swin->swinid)
00161             freewinid = swin->swinid + 1;
00162 
00163     win->curswin = swin = MEM_callocN(sizeof(wmSubWindow), "swinopen");
00164     BLI_addtail(&win->subwindows, swin);
00165     
00166     if (G.debug & G_DEBUG_EVENTS) {
00167         printf("%s: swin %d added\n", __func__, freewinid);
00168     }
00169 
00170     swin->swinid = freewinid;
00171     swin->winrct = *winrct;
00172 
00173     /* and we appy it all right away */
00174     wmSubWindowSet(win, swin->swinid);
00175     
00176     /* extra service */
00177     wm_subwindow_getsize(win, swin->swinid, &width, &height);
00178     wmOrtho2(-0.375f, (float)width - 0.375f, -0.375f, (float)height - 0.375f);
00179     glLoadIdentity();
00180 
00181     return swin->swinid;
00182 }
00183 
00184 
00185 void wm_subwindow_close(wmWindow *win, int swinid)
00186 {
00187     wmSubWindow *swin = swin_from_swinid(win, swinid);
00188 
00189     if (swin) {
00190         if (swin == win->curswin)
00191             win->curswin = NULL;
00192         wm_subwindow_free(swin);
00193         BLI_remlink(&win->subwindows, swin);
00194         MEM_freeN(swin);
00195     } 
00196     else {
00197         printf("wm_subwindow_close: Internal error, bad winid: %d\n", swinid);
00198     }
00199 
00200 }
00201 
00202 /* pixels go from 0-99 for a 100 pixel window */
00203 void wm_subwindow_position(wmWindow *win, int swinid, rcti *winrct)
00204 {
00205     wmSubWindow *swin = swin_from_swinid(win, swinid);
00206     
00207     if (swin) {
00208         int width, height;
00209         
00210         swin->winrct = *winrct;
00211         
00212         /* CRITICAL, this clamping ensures that
00213          * the viewport never goes outside the screen
00214          * edges (assuming the x, y coords aren't
00215          *        outside). This caused a hardware lock
00216          * on Matrox cards if it happens.
00217          *
00218          * Really Blender should never _ever_ try
00219          * to do such a thing, but just to be safe
00220          * clamp it anyway (or fix the bScreen
00221          * scaling routine, and be damn sure you
00222          * fixed it). - zr  (2001!)
00223          */
00224         
00225         if (swin->winrct.xmax > win->sizex)
00226             swin->winrct.xmax = win->sizex;
00227         if (swin->winrct.ymax > win->sizey)
00228             swin->winrct.ymax = win->sizey;
00229         
00230         /* extra service */
00231         wmSubWindowSet(win, swinid);
00232         wm_subwindow_getsize(win, swinid, &width, &height);
00233         wmOrtho2(-0.375f, (float)width - 0.375f, -0.375f, (float)height - 0.375f);
00234     }
00235     else {
00236         printf("wm_subwindow_position: Internal error, bad winid: %d\n", swinid);
00237     }
00238 }

00240 /* ---------------- WM versions of OpenGL calls, using glBlah() syntax ------------------------ */
00241 /* ----------------- exported in WM_api.h ------------------------------------------------------ */
00242 
00243 /* internal state, no threaded opengl! XXX */
00244 static wmWindow *_curwindow = NULL;
00245 static wmSubWindow *_curswin = NULL;
00246 
00247 void wmSubWindowScissorSet(wmWindow *win, int swinid, rcti *srct)
00248 {
00249     int width, height;
00250     _curswin = swin_from_swinid(win, swinid);
00251     
00252     if (_curswin == NULL) {
00253         printf("wmSubWindowSet %d: doesn't exist\n", swinid);
00254         return;
00255     }
00256     
00257     win->curswin = _curswin;
00258     _curwindow = win;
00259     
00260     width = _curswin->winrct.xmax - _curswin->winrct.xmin + 1;
00261     height = _curswin->winrct.ymax - _curswin->winrct.ymin + 1;
00262     glViewport(_curswin->winrct.xmin, _curswin->winrct.ymin, width, height);
00263 
00264     if (srct) {
00265         width = srct->xmax - srct->xmin + 1;
00266         height = srct->ymax - srct->ymin + 1;
00267         glScissor(srct->xmin, srct->ymin, width, height);
00268     }
00269     else
00270         glScissor(_curswin->winrct.xmin, _curswin->winrct.ymin, width, height);
00271     
00272     wmOrtho2(-0.375f, (float)width - 0.375f, -0.375f, (float)height - 0.375f);
00273     glLoadIdentity();
00274 
00275     glFlush();
00276 }
00277 
00278 
00279 /* enable the WM versions of opengl calls */
00280 void wmSubWindowSet(wmWindow *win, int swinid)
00281 {
00282     wmSubWindowScissorSet(win, swinid, NULL);
00283 }
00284 
00285 void wmFrustum(float x1, float x2, float y1, float y2, float n, float f)
00286 {
00287     glMatrixMode(GL_PROJECTION);
00288     glLoadIdentity();
00289     glFrustum(x1, x2, y1, y2, n, f);
00290     glMatrixMode(GL_MODELVIEW);
00291 }
00292 
00293 void wmOrtho(float x1, float x2, float y1, float y2, float n, float f)
00294 {
00295     glMatrixMode(GL_PROJECTION);
00296     glLoadIdentity();
00297 
00298     glOrtho(x1, x2, y1, y2, n, f);
00299 
00300     glMatrixMode(GL_MODELVIEW);
00301 }
00302 
00303 void wmOrtho2(float x1, float x2, float y1, float y2)
00304 {
00305     /* prevent opengl from generating errors */
00306     if (x1 == x2) x2 += 1.0f;
00307     if (y1 == y2) y2 += 1.0f;
00308 
00309     wmOrtho(x1, x2, y1, y2, -100, 100);
00310 }
00311 
00312 /* *************************** Framebuffer color depth, for selection codes ********************** */
00313 
00314 #ifdef __APPLE__
00315 
00316 /* apple seems to round colors to below and up on some configs */
00317 
00318 unsigned int index_to_framebuffer(int index)
00319 {
00320     unsigned int i = index;
00321 
00322     switch (GPU_color_depth()) {
00323         case 12:
00324             i = ((i & 0xF00) << 12) + ((i & 0xF0) << 8) + ((i & 0xF) << 4);
00325             /* sometimes dithering subtracts! */
00326             i |= 0x070707;
00327             break;
00328         case 15:
00329         case 16:
00330             i = ((i & 0x7C00) << 9) + ((i & 0x3E0) << 6) + ((i & 0x1F) << 3);
00331             i |= 0x030303;
00332             break;
00333         case 24:
00334             break;
00335         default: // 18 bits...
00336             i = ((i & 0x3F000) << 6) + ((i & 0xFC0) << 4) + ((i & 0x3F) << 2);
00337             i |= 0x010101;
00338             break;
00339     }
00340     
00341     return i;
00342 }
00343 
00344 #else
00345 
00346 /* this is the old method as being in use for ages.... seems to work? colors are rounded to lower values */
00347 
00348 unsigned int index_to_framebuffer(int index)
00349 {
00350     unsigned int i = index;
00351     
00352     switch (GPU_color_depth()) {
00353         case 8:
00354             i = ((i & 48) << 18) + ((i & 12) << 12) + ((i & 3) << 6);
00355             i |= 0x3F3F3F;
00356             break;
00357         case 12:
00358             i = ((i & 0xF00) << 12) + ((i & 0xF0) << 8) + ((i & 0xF) << 4);
00359             /* sometimes dithering subtracts! */
00360             i |= 0x0F0F0F;
00361             break;
00362         case 15:
00363         case 16:
00364             i = ((i & 0x7C00) << 9) + ((i & 0x3E0) << 6) + ((i & 0x1F) << 3);
00365             i |= 0x070707;
00366             break;
00367         case 24:
00368             break;
00369         default:    // 18 bits...
00370             i = ((i & 0x3F000) << 6) + ((i & 0xFC0) << 4) + ((i & 0x3F) << 2);
00371             i |= 0x030303;
00372             break;
00373     }
00374     
00375     return i;
00376 }
00377 
00378 #endif
00379 
00380 void WM_set_framebuffer_index_color(int index)
00381 {
00382     const int col = index_to_framebuffer(index);
00383     cpack(col);
00384 }
00385 
00386 int WM_framebuffer_to_index(unsigned int col)
00387 {
00388     if (col == 0) return 0;
00389 
00390     switch (GPU_color_depth()) {
00391         case 8:
00392             return ((col & 0xC00000) >> 18) + ((col & 0xC000) >> 12) + ((col & 0xC0) >> 6);
00393         case 12:
00394             return ((col & 0xF00000) >> 12) + ((col & 0xF000) >> 8) + ((col & 0xF0) >> 4);
00395         case 15:
00396         case 16:
00397             return ((col & 0xF80000) >> 9) + ((col & 0xF800) >> 6) + ((col & 0xF8) >> 3);
00398         case 24:
00399             return col & 0xFFFFFF;
00400         default: // 18 bits...
00401             return ((col & 0xFC0000) >> 6) + ((col & 0xFC00) >> 4) + ((col & 0xFC) >> 2);
00402     }       
00403 }
